p:
Briefly, we assumed that a host of the age and sex class a ∈ { Y, J
f , J
m , F, M} can be either susceptible ( X
a ), latently infected ( L
a ), infectious ( Y
a ) or recovered ( R
a ). In the model, the exact number of hosts that change state or age class is determined by a binomial distribution with the probability p
i = 1 − exp(− r
i Δ t), where r
i are rates of changes computed for each i
th transition and Δ t is the time-step. The model further assumes that no maternal immunity would be acquired by foals, leaving them susceptible to infection from birth. Similarly, no cross protection between AHS types was assumed; hence, all zebra are susceptible to any given AHS type, irrespective of historical exposure to other types.
